Infertile couple could include follow medical consultation infertility Couples none member face comprehension difficulty oral write French language Couples member affiliate French NHS [ national health service ] ( beneficiary legal claimant ) Specific fertile couple : fertile couple naturally spontaneously conceive many child time conceive short 12 month . Specific infertile couple : Infertile couple ( primary , infertility , inability conceive child 12 month unprotected sexual intercourse ) Couples male partner sperm parameter compatible natural conception Couples female partner present anovulation , ovarian insufficiency uterustubal pathology Common infertile fertile couple : couple one member eighteen childbearing age ( > 38 woman > 45 men ) couple least one member refuse give write agreement study couple least one member show know cardiovascular risk ( diabetes , hypercholesterolemia , HBR ) couple least one member show know cardiovascular pathology , digestive pathology , good absorptive pathology cancer couple least one member face difficulty understand French language couple least one member affiliate French NHS ( beneficiary legal claimant ) Specific fertile couple : •Couples woman miscarriage medical termination pregnancy current partner Specific infertile couple : Couples first pregnancy Couples male member show either : severe oligozoospermia ( < 5 millions/ml ) confirm azoospermia ( absence spermatozoid ejaculate ) moderate non idiopathic oligozoospermia ( 520 millions/ml ) , related one follow factor : 1. toxic ( chemotherapy , radiotherapy , drug demonstrate effect spermatogenesis ) 2. infectious 3. anatomic : vasectomy , congenital anomaly ( agenesis va deferens ) , long posttraumatic ischemia 4. endocrine : hypogonadotropic , hypogonadism 5. cytogenetic : klinefelter syndrome , translocation couple whose male partner show abnormality male genital tractus : VARICOCEME undescended , testis , testicular volume < 12ml couple whose female partner present anovulation , ovarian insufficiency proven uterustubal pathology
